t: Mark 10
The Question of Divorce
He*p set out from there and went to the region of Judea and across the Jordan. Then crowds converged on him again, and as was his custom he taught them again.
Some*p Pharisees came to test him, asking, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”
He*p replied to them, “What*r did*r Moses*r command*r you?”*r
They*p said, “Moses permitted us to write divorce papers and send her away.”
But*p Jesus told them, “He*r wrote*r this*r command*r for*r you*r because*r of*r the*r hardness*r of*r your*r hearts.*r
But*r from*r the*r beginning*r of*r creation*r God*r made*ir them*ir male*ir and*ir female.*ir
For*ir this*ir reason*ir a*ir man*ir will*ir leave*ir his*ir father*ir and*ir mother*ir
and*ir the*ir two*ir will*ir become*ir one*ir flesh.*ir So*ir they*ir are*ir no*ir longer*ir two,*ir but*ir one*ir flesh.*ir
Therefore*r what*r God*r has*r joined*r together,*r let*r no*r one*r separate.”*r
When*p they were in the house again, the disciples questioned him about this matter.
He said to them, “Whoever*r divorces*r his*r wife*r and*r marries*r another*r commits*r adultery*r against*r her.*r
Also,*r if*r she*r divorces*r her*r husband*r and*r marries*r another,*r she*r commits*r adultery.”*r
Blessing the Children
People*p were bringing little children to him in order that he might touch them, but the disciples rebuked them.

When Jesus saw it, he was indignant and said to them, “Let*r the*r little*r children*r come*r to*r me.*r Don’t*r stop*r them,*r because*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r belongs*r to*r such*r as*r these.*r
Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r whoever*r does*r not*r receive*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r like*r a*r little*r child*r will*r never*r enter*r it.”*r
After taking them in his arms, he laid his hands on them and blessed them.
The Rich Young Ruler
As*p he was setting out on a journey, a man ran up, knelt down before him, and asked him, “Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
“Why*rp do*r you*r call*r me*r good?”*r Jesus asked him. “No*r one*r is*r good*r except*r God*r alone.*r

You*r know*r the*r commandments:*r Do*ir not*ir murder;*ir do*ir not*ir commit*ir adultery;*ir do*ir not*ir steal;*ir do*ir not*ir bear*ir false*ir witness;*ir do*ir not*ir defraud;*ir honor*ir your*ir father*ir and*ir mother.”*ir
He*p said to him, “Teacher, I have kept all these from my youth.”

Looking*p at him, Jesus loved him and said to him, “You*r lack*r one*r thing:*r Go,*r sell*r all*r you*r have*r and*r give*r to*r the*r poor,*r and*r you*r will*r have*r treasure*r in*r heaven.*r Then*r come,*r follow*r me.”*r
But he was dismayed by this demand, and he went away grieving, because he had many possessions.
Possessions and the Kingdom
Jesus*p looked around and said to his disciples, “How*r hard*r it*r is*r for*r those*r who*r have*r wealth*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God!”*r
The*p disciples were astonished at his words. Again Jesus said to them, “Children,*r how*r hard*r it*r is*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God!*r
It*r is*r easier*r for*r a*r camel*r to*r go*r through*r the*r eye*r of*r a*r needle*r than*r for*r a*r rich*r person*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
They*p were even more astonished, saying to one another, “Then who can be saved?”
Looking*p at them, Jesus said, “With*r man*r it*r is*r impossible,*r but*r not*r with*r God,*r because*r all*r things*r are*r possible*r with*r God.”*r
Peter*p began to tell him, “Look, we have left everything and followed you.”

“Truly*rp I*r tell*r you,”*r Jesus said, “there*r is*r no*r one*r who*r has*r left*r house*r or*r brothers*r or*r sisters*r or*r mother*r or*r father*r or*r children*r or*r fields*r for*r my*r sake*r and*r for*r the*r sake*r of*r the*r gospel,*r

who*r will*r not*r receive*r a*r hundred*r times*r more,*r now*r at*r this*r time*r — houses,*r brothers*r and*r sisters,*r mothers*r and*r children,*r and*r fields,*r with*r persecutions*r — and*r eternal*r life*r in*r the*r age*r to*r come.*r
But*r many*r who*r are*r first*r will*r be*r last,*r and*r the*r last*r first.”*r
The Third Prediction of His Death

They*p were on the road, going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was walking ahead of them. The disciples were astonished, but those who followed him were afraid. Taking the Twelve aside again, he began to tell them the things that would happen to him.

“See,*r we*r are*r going*r up*r to*r Jerusalem.*r The*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r handed*r over*r to*r the*r chief*r priests*r and*r the*r scribes,*r and*r they*r will*r condemn*r him*r to*r death.*r Then*r they*r will*r hand*r him*r over*r to*r the*r Gentiles,*r
and*r they*r will*r mock*r him,*r spit*r on*r him,*r flog*r him,*r and*r kill*r him,*r and*r he*r will*r rise*r after*r three*r days.”*r
Suffering and Service
James*p and John, the sons of Zebedee, approached him and said, “Teacher, we want you to do whatever we ask you.”
“What*rp do*r you*r want*r me*r to*r do*r for*r you?”*r he asked them.
They*p answered him, “Allow us to sit at your right and at your left in your glory.”

Jesus*p said to them, “You*r don’t*r know*r what*r you’re*r asking.*r Are*r you*r able*r to*r drink*r the*r cup*r I*r drink*r or*r to*r be*r baptized*r with*r the*r baptism*r I*r am*r baptized*r with?”*r
“We*p are able,” they told him. Jesus*p said to them, “You*r will*r drink*r the*r cup*r I*r drink,*r and*r you*r will*r be*r baptized*r with*r the*r baptism*r I*r am*r baptized*r with.*r
But*r to*r sit*r at*r my*r right*r or*r left*r is*r not*r mine*r to*r give;*r instead,*r it*r is*r for*r those*r for*r whom*r it*r has*r been*r prepared.”*r
When*p the ten disciples heard this, they began to be indignant with James and John.

Jesus called them over and said to them, “You*r know*r that*r those*r who*r are*r regarded*r as*r rulers*r of*r the*r Gentiles*r lord*r it*r over*r them,*r and*r those*r in*r high*r positions*r act*r as*r tyrants*r over*r them.*r
But*r it*r is*r not*r so*r among*r you.*r On*r the*r contrary,*r whoever*r wants*r to*r become*r great*r among*r you*r will*r be*r your*r servant,*r
and*r whoever*r wants*r to*r be*r first*r among*r you*r will*r be*r a*r slave*r to*r all.*r
For*r even*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r did*r not*r come*r to*r be*r served,*r but*r to*r serve,*r and*r to*r give*r his*r life*r as*r a*r ransom*r for*r many.”*r
A Blind Man Healed
They*p came to Jericho. And as he was leaving Jericho with his disciples and a large crowd, Bartimaeus (the son of Timaeus), a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.
When he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Many warned him to keep quiet, but he was crying out all the more, “Have mercy on me, Son of David!”
Jesus*p stopped and said, “Call*r him.”*r So*p they called the blind man and said to him, “Have courage! Get up; he’s calling for you.”
He threw off his coat, jumped up, and came to Jesus.
Then*p Jesus answered him, “What*r do*r you*r want*r me*r to*r do*r for*r you?”*r “Rabboni,”*bp the blind man said to him, “I want to see.”
Jesus*p said to him, “Go,*r your*r faith*r has*r saved*r you.”*r Immediately he could see and began to follow Jesus on the road.
